title: MolHF: A Hierarchical Normalizing Flow for Molecular Graph Generation. (arXiv:2305.08457v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: Molecular de novo design is a critical yet challenging task in scientific fields, aiming to design novel molecular structures with desired property profiles. Significant progress has been made by resorting to generative models for graphs. However, limited attention is paid to hierarchical generative models, which can exploit the inherent hierarchical structure (with rich semantic information) of the molecular graphs and generate complex molecules of larger size that we shall demonstrate to be difficult for most existing models. The primary challenge to hierarchical generation is the non-differentiable issue caused by the generation of intermediate discrete coarsened graph structures. To sidestep this issue, we cast the tricky hierarchical generation problem over discrete spaces as the reverse process of hierarchical representation learning and propose MolHF, a new hierarchical flow-based model that generates molecular graphs in a coarse-to-fine manner. translated_abstract: 分子的去 novo 设计是科学领域中关键但具有挑战性的任务，旨在设计具有所需特性的新型分子结构。通过使用生成模型对图进行建模已经取得了显著进展。然而，对于可以利用分子图的内在分层结构（具有丰富的语义信息）并生成更大的复杂分子的分层生成模型，付出的注意力有限。分层生成的主要挑战是由于生成中间离散粗化图结构而导致的不可微问题。为了避免此问题，我们将棘手的分层生成问题在离散空间上表达为分层表示学习的反向过程，并提出了 MolHF，一种新的层次流模型，以粗略-细化的方式生成分子图。
tldr: MolHF是一种新型的分层流模型，能够生成复杂的分子图，并避免了在分层生成中的不可微问题。
en_tdlr: MolHF is a new hierarchical flow-based model that can generate complex molecular graphs and avoid the non-differentiable issue caused by hierarchical generation.
